title: 105_s243
content: The Act may be cited as the "Airport and Airway Trust Fund Taxes Short Term Reinstatement Act" and involves the temporary reinstatement of airport and airway trust fund taxes. The fuel tax rate specified in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to 4.3 cents per gallon after December 31, 1996, and before the enactment of the Airport and Airway Trust Fund Taxes Short Term Reinstatement Act, and after September 29, 1997. The Trust Fund Taxes Short Term Reinstatement Act amended the fuel tax rate to 4.3 cents per gallon after December 31, 1996, and before the enactment of the Act, and after September 29, 1997. The Airport and Airway Trust Fund Taxes Short Term Reinstatement Act amended tax rates to 4.3 cents per gallon after December 31, 1996, and before September 29, 1997. The Airport and Airway Trust Fund Taxes Short Term Reinstatement Act amended tax rates for specific periods, including from August 27, 1996, to December 31, 1996, and from 7 days after enactment to September 29, 1997. Ticket taxes were also adjusted accordingly. The Airport and Airway Trust Fund Taxes Short Term Reinstatement Act amended tax rates for specific periods, including from August 27, 1996, to December 31, 1996, and from 7 days after enactment to September 29, 1997. Ticket taxes were adjusted accordingly to transportation beginning on or after the date which is 7 days after the date of enactment of the Act, and before September 30, 1997. The Airport and Airway Trust Fund Taxes Short Term Reinstatement Act amended tax rates for specific periods, including from August 27, 1996, to December 31, 1996, and from 7 days after enactment to September 29, 1997. The Act also adjusted the Airport and Airway Trust Fund financing rate to zero for taxes imposed after September 29, 1997. Before the enactment of the Airport and Airway Trust Fund Taxes Short Term Reinstatement Act, a floor stocks tax of 17.5 cents per gallon is imposed on aviation fuel held by any person on the tax-increase date. A floor stocks tax of 17.5 cents per gallon is imposed on aviation fuel held by any person on the tax-increase date, with liability and method of payment specified by the Revenue Code of 1986. The tax imposed by paragraph (1) must be paid as prescribed by the Secretary, and it is due on the first day of the 7th month after the tax-increase date. Definitions include "the Code" referring to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, and "tax-increase date" as 7 calendar days after a specific date. The term "the Code" refers to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The term "tax-increase date" is defined as 7 calendar days after the enactment of the Act. "Aviation fuel" is defined as per section 4093 of the Code. Aviation fuel is considered "held by a person" if title has passed to that person. Aviation fuel is considered "held by a person" if title has passed to that person. The term "Secretary" refers to the Secretary of the Treasury or his delegate. The tax imposed on aviation fuel shall not apply to fuel held exclusively for certain uses on the tax-increase date. On the tax-increase date, aviation fuel held for specific uses may be exempt from the tax imposed by section 4091 of the Code. No tax will be imposed on aviation fuel held by a person if the total amount does not exceed 2,000 gallons on that date. On the tax-increase date, aviation fuel held by a person may be exempt from the tax if the total amount does not exceed 2,000 gallons, provided the person submits required information to the Secretary. Exempt fuel is not considered for tax purposes if held by a person exempt from the tax. Controlled groups are treated as one group for tax purposes. For tax purposes, all persons in a controlled group are treated as one group. The definition of a controlled group follows specific criteria outlined in the tax code. For tax purposes, all persons in a controlled group are treated as one group. Section 1563 of the Code states that the phrase "more than 50 percent" replaces "at least 80 percent" in certain cases. Nonincorporated persons under common control are subject to similar principles as incorporated groups. Nonincorporated persons under common control are subject to similar principles as incorporated groups, with regulations prescribed by the Secretary. All provisions of law applicable to taxes imposed by section 4091 of the Code apply to groups of persons under common control. The amendments made by this section, including the floor stock taxes imposed, will take effect 7 days after the enactment of the Act. Transportation using tickets purchased during the lapse period will also be subject to taxes imposed by sections 4261 and 4271 of the Code. The amendments made by this section will take effect 7 days after the enactment of the Act. Taxes on transportation using tickets purchased during the lapse period will not apply after December 31, 1996, and before the effective date of the amendments. Section 9502(b) of the Code is amended to transfer taxes collected during the taxable period regardless of when paid. Any amount received in the Treasury after specific dates shall be treated as received on the day before such date. The effective date for this amendment is after December 31, 1995.
